abstract: Chip delays and cancellations have become the norm in the high-profit Unix server market. But I.B.M. says its Power7 chip should arrive on time next year, pressuring rivals.
snippet: Chip delays and cancellations have become the norm in the high-profit Unix server market. But I.B.M. says its Power7 chip should arrive on time next year, pressuring rivals.
lead_paragraph: Good news has been tough to come by in the world of super-fancy server chips, with companies like Intel and Sun Microsystems delaying and killing off products.

headline.main: I.B.M. Expects On-Time Arrival for Power7 Chip
